info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 08 at 8:44AM CDT until April 08 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Potential Increasing... .Recent runs of guidance currently picking up on the drier than anticipated start to the morning is leading to increasing confidence in multiple hours of critical fire weather across Norton and Graham counties this afternoon. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 004 AND 016... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM CDT this evening. * Affected Area...In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 004 Norton and Fire Weather Zone 016 Graham. * Winds...South 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...Around 12 percent. * Temperatures...In the upper 70s. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised. Some localized areas of blowing dust are possible especially near open fields which may make fires difficult to see.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
